20110125190007.000|20110125190009.000|TR0|ALI VELSHI, CNN ANCHOR:  And it is the 
20110125190009.000|20110125190011.000|TR0|annual spectacle in America's politics, 
20110125190011.000|20110125190014.000|TR0|the president's report to Congress on the 
20110125190014.000|20110125190016.000|TR0|State of the Union.  The Constitution 
20110125190016.000|20110125190019.000|TR0|demands it though not necessarily yearly 
20110125190019.000|20110125190021.000|TR0|and not even in person.  This year's 
20110125190021.000|20110125190023.000|TR0|address, now seven hours away, comes at a 
20110125190023.000|20110125190026.000|TR0|turning point.  Americans are more 
20110125190026.000|20110125190028.000|TR0|optimistic than we have been in almost 
20110125190028.000|20110125190031.000|TR0|four years, and Congress is more divided.
20110125190031.000|20110125190033.000|TR0|
20110125190033.000|20110125190035.000|TR0|The midterm elections put Republicans in 
20110125190035.000|20110125190038.000|TR0|charge of the House and created a Tea 
20110125190038.000|20110125190040.000|TR0|Party Caucus that is a force unto itself.  
20110125190040.000|20110125190043.000|TR0|A brand new CNN poll shows that we the 
20110125190043.000|20110125190045.000|TR0|people still care most about the economy. 
20110125190045.000|20110125190048.000|TR0|Check out this list of extremely important 
20110125190048.000|20110125190050.000|TR0|issues according to CNN/Opinion Research 
20110125190050.000|20110125190052.000|TR0|Corporation's polling.
20110125190052.000|20110125190055.000|TR0|
20110125190055.000|20110125190057.000|TR0|The economy, by far, the number one issue, 
20110125190057.000|20110125190100.000|TR0|followed by unemployment, health care, the 
20110125190100.000|20110125190102.000|TR0|deficit, and Social Security.  All of 
20110125190102.000|20110125190104.000|TR0|those top five issues having to do with 
20110125190104.000|20110125190107.000|TR0|money.
20110125190107.000|20110125190109.000|TR0|
20110125190109.000|20110125190112.000|TR0|Non-money issues fall lower on the list -- 
20110125190112.000|20110125190114.000|TR0|education, terrorism, Afghanistan, Iraq.  
20110125190114.000|20110125190116.000|TR0|And for all the sound and fury, gay 
20110125190116.000|20110125190119.000|TR0|marriage is seen as an extremely important 
20110125190119.000|20110125190121.000|TR0|issue by only 15 percent of Americans.
20110125190121.000|20110125190124.000|TR0|
20110125190124.000|20110125190126.000|TR0|Now, I mentioned optimism.  Forty-three 
20110125190126.000|20110125190129.000|TR0|percent of us say things are going well in 
20110125190129.000|20110125190131.000|TR0|America; 56 percent feel the opposite.
20110125190131.000|20110125190133.000|TR0|
20110125190133.000|20110125190136.000|TR0|Now, take a look at the increase from 
20110125190136.000|20110125190138.000|TR0|December, though.  In December, only 29 
20110125190138.000|20110125190141.000|TR0|percent thought things were going well.  
20110125190141.000|20110125190143.000|TR0|It's up to 53 percent.  Seventy-one 
20110125190143.000|20110125190145.000|TR0|percent thought things were going badly, 
20110125190145.000|20110125190148.000|TR0|and that's down to 56.
20110125190148.000|20110125190150.000|TR0|
20110125190150.000|20110125190153.000|TR0|There is a partisan slant to this, but not 
20110125190153.000|20110125190155.000|TR0|the one you'd expect. Democrats, in spite 
20110125190155.000|20110125190157.000|TR0|of the GOP juggernaut in November, are 
20110125190157.000|20110125190200.000|TR0|most optimistic by far.  December, 41 
20110125190200.000|20110125190202.000|TR0|percent of them thought things were going 
20110125190202.000|20110125190205.000|TR0|well, now 65 percent.
20110125190205.000|20110125190207.000|TR0|
20110125190207.000|20110125190210.000|TR0|Republicans have increased as well, and so 
20110125190210.000|20110125190212.000|TR0|have Independents. Everybody is feeling a 
20110125190212.000|20110125190214.000|TR0|little better than they did in December.

20110125191031.000|20110125191034.000|TR0|probably have to hire me. But I think that

20110125191036.000|20110125191038.000|TR0|because he's got to combat what I would

20110125191041.000|20110125191043.000|TR0|American public for years now with the 
20110125191043.000|20110125191046.000|TR0|trickle-down economics, that government 
20110125191046.000|20110125191048.000|TR0|shouldn't invest in its own country, in 
20110125191048.000|20110125191051.000|TR0|the economy, to help create jobs and

20110125192101.000|20110125192103.000|TR0|Deepwater Horizon oil rig blew up, killing

20110125192106.000|20110125192108.000|TR0|million gallons of oil into the Gulf of 
20110125192108.000|20110125192110.000|TR0|Mexico over 85 days.

20110125192748.000|20110125192751.000|TR0|is about food labels.
20110125192751.000|20110125192753.000|TR0|
20110125192753.000|20110125192756.000|TR0|Now, we see nutrition labels like these.  
20110125192756.000|20110125192758.000|TR0|All right?  You see them on everything you 
20110125192758.000|20110125192801.000|TR0|buy, packaged food all across the country.
20110125192801.000|20110125192803.000|TR0|
20110125192803.000|20110125192805.000|TR0|Now, we're able to see by looking at this 
20110125192805.000|20110125192808.000|TR0|exact calories, fat, cholesterol, sodium, 
20110125192808.000|20110125192810.000|TR0|carb content, things like that.  But some 
20110125192810.000|20110125192813.000|TR0|people say that's not enough.  They want 
20110125192813.000|20110125192815.000|TR0|labels on the front of the package. It's 
20110125192815.000|20110125192817.000|TR0|called front of package labeling.  It's 
20110125192817.000|20110125192820.000|TR0|been a passion of first lady Michelle 
20110125192820.000|20110125192822.000|TR0|Obama's to help us make more informed 
20110125192822.000|20110125192825.000|TR0|decisions.
20110125192825.000|20110125192827.000|TR0|
20110125192827.000|20110125192829.000|TR0|Now, last year, Mrs. Obama asked the food 
20110125192829.000|20110125192832.000|TR0|industry to design a new system to 
20110125192832.000|20110125192834.000|TR0|highlight nutritional information on the 
20110125192834.000|20110125192837.000|TR0|front packaging -- on the front of a 
20110125192837.000|20110125192839.000|TR0|package.  The Grocery Manufacturers 
20110125192839.000|20110125192842.000|TR0|Association and the Food Marketing 
20110125192842.000|20110125192844.000|TR0|Institute are out with their pitch, and 
20110125192844.000|20110125192846.000|TR0|it's called Nutrition Keys.
20110125192846.000|20110125192849.000|TR0|
20110125192849.000|20110125192851.000|TR0|It contains four basic icons for calories, 
20110125192851.000|20110125192854.000|TR0|saturated fats, sodium, and sugars.  On 
20110125192854.000|20110125192856.000|TR0|small food packages, one icon can be used 
20110125192856.000|20110125192858.000|TR0|for calorie count per serving.
20110125192858.000|20110125192901.000|TR0|
20110125192901.000|20110125192903.000|TR0|Now, they also pitched this possible 
20110125192903.000|20110125192906.000|TR0|option.  It's a panel of six icons.  The 
20110125192906.000|20110125192908.000|TR0|four original panels for calories, 
20110125192908.000|20110125192910.000|TR0|saturated fat, sodium, and sugars, and 
20110125192910.000|20110125192913.000|TR0|then something called nutrients to 
20110125192913.000|20110125192915.000|TR0|encourage.  They define those as 
20110125192915.000|20110125192918.000|TR0|potassium, fiber, protein, Vitamin A, 
20110125192918.000|20110125192920.000|TR0|Vitamin C, Vitamin D, calcium and iron.
20110125192920.000|20110125192923.000|TR0|

20110125193016.000|20110125193018.000|TR0|beef."
20110125193018.000|20110125193020.000|TR0|

20110125193023.000|20110125193025.000|TR0|Taco Bell by a California customer who 
20110125193025.000|20110125193028.000|TR0|calls the beef in the tacos "meat mixture

20110125195347.000|20110125195349.000|TR0|But what's the real story behind the 
20110125195349.000|20110125195352.000|TR0|Hollywood hit?  CNN's Nick Glass 
20110125195352.000|20110125195354.000|TR0|introduces us to the man behind the 
20110125195354.000|20110125195356.000|TR0|Hollywood character.
20110125195356.000|20110125195359.000|TR0|
20110125195359.000|20110125195401.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20110125195401.000|20110125195404.000|TR0|
20110125195404.000|20110125195406.000|TR0|NICK GLASS, CNN CORRESPONDENT 
20110125195406.000|20110125195408.000|TR0|(voice-over): It's some archive, retrieved 
20110125195408.000|20110125195411.000|TR0|from storage after half a century and 
20110125195411.000|20110125195413.000|TR0|spread across a kitchen table in north 
20110125195413.000|20110125195416.000|TR0|London.  Old letters, documents, albums, 
20110125195416.000|20110125195418.000|TR0|photographs, and newspaper cuttings.
20110125195418.000|20110125195420.000|TR0|
20110125195420.000|20110125195423.000|TR0|Here's the story of a friendship between a 
20110125195423.000|20110125195425.000|TR0|man who would be king and the Australian 
20110125195425.000|20110125195428.000|TR0|speech therapist who helped him overcome 
20110125195428.000|20110125195430.000|TR0|his stammer.  The real Lionel Logue was 
20110125195430.000|20110125195433.000|TR0|more deferential and rather shorter than 
20110125195433.000|20110125195435.000|TR0|his movie counterpart.  But the key speech 
20110125195435.000|20110125195437.000|TR0|from the film is historically accurate, 
20110125195437.000|20110125195440.000|TR0|word for word, as it had to be.
20110125195440.000|20110125195442.000|TR0|
20110125195442.000|20110125195445.000|TR0|MARK LOGUE, LIONEL LOGUE'S GRANDSON:  In 
20110125195445.000|20110125195447.000|TR0|this grave hour, perhaps the most --
20110125195447.000|20110125195449.000|TR0|
20110125195449.000|20110125195452.000|TR0|GLASS: These may well be the pages George 
20110125195452.000|20110125195454.000|TR0|VI held in his hands when he spoke on 
20110125195454.000|20110125195457.000|TR0|radio in the outbreak of war in 1939.  
20110125195457.000|20110125195459.000|TR0|Lionel Logue marked the pages in pencil.  
20110125195459.000|20110125195501.000|TR0|"Stress this word."  "Pause here."
20110125195501.000|20110125195504.000|TR0|
20110125195504.000|20110125195506.000|TR0|A grandson has pieced the story together 
20110125195506.000|20110125195509.000|TR0|from documents he inherited.
20110125195509.000|20110125195511.000|TR0|
20110125195511.000|20110125195514.000|TR0|LOGUE:  The content of the letters between 
20110125195514.000|20110125195516.000|TR0|them are incredibly friendly like you'd 
20110125195516.000|20110125195518.000|TR0|expect between two friends.  There is this 
20110125195518.000|20110125195521.000|TR0|kind of etiquette that Lionel still abides 
20110125195521.000|20110125195523.000|TR0|by, which is, your royal highness. The 
20110125195523.000|20110125195526.000|TR0|letters back to him from the king are, My 
20110125195526.000|20110125195528.000|TR0|Dear Logue.
20110125195528.000|20110125195530.000|TR0|
20110125195530.000|20110125195533.000|TR0|The first thing that really was startling 
20110125195533.000|20110125195535.000|TR0|was the appointment card.
20110125195535.000|20110125195538.000|TR0|
20110125195538.000|20110125195540.000|TR0|GLASS: In tiny handwriting, Loge assessed 
20110125195540.000|20110125195542.000|TR0|his new patient, Albert Duke of York, in 
20110125195542.000|20110125195545.000|TR0|1926.
20110125195545.000|20110125195547.000|TR0|
20110125195547.000|20110125195550.000|TR0|LOGUE:  Has an acute nervous tension, 
20110125195550.000|20110125195552.000|TR0|which is being brought on by the defect.
20110125195552.000|20110125195555.000|TR0|

20110125195557.000|20110125195559.000|TR0|duke saw Logue saw him almost every day 
20110125195559.000|20110125195602.000|TR0|for the next two or three months in 
20110125195602.000|20110125195604.000|TR0|advance of a royal visit to Australia.

20110125195607.000|20110125195609.000|TR0|rest of their lives, although they were
